instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will only turn on when battery is plugged but it wont charge, magsafe will turn orange when machine is turned off.
threads.message:
without battery, when 1st plug in, I can hear the chime but screen is black and the fan will spin up for 5 seconds before it repeat, when it repeats, I hear no more chime.

when plugged a battery, it will boot up, sometimes normal speed and sometimes very slowly, and it wont charge the battery either as it stayed green.

When it is shutdown, then magsafe will turn orange.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>: 
17/18 = 3 ohm
27/28 = 21 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will only turn on when battery is plugged but it wont charge, magsafe will turn orange when machine is turned off.
threads.message:
Any history available?
Did you try starting in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will only turn on when battery is plugged but it wont charge, magsafe will turn orange when machine is turned off.
threads.message:
unknown history.. minor corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C4314</CAPACITOR>/L4310, also <CAPACITOR>C7524</CAPACITOR> and then some unknown liquid residue around <CAPACITOR>C7623</CAPACITOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>.. I cleaned them off with alcohol.

<CAPACITOR>C7042</CAPACITOR> which is around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> seems to have corrosion around it...I have replaced <CAPACITOR>C7042</CAPACITOR> and it seems to be ok now.. let me do some more testing..
